results.title: Electro-magnetic induction
results.brief_description: The relationship between magnetic fields and electric currents; basic principles of electromagnetic induction; production, transmission and use of electricity depends on the basic relationship between electricity and magnetism.

results.title: Electrolysis
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and MGM International Films
results.brief_description: Standard electrolysis equipment is set up and operated to demonstrate the conduction of electricity through a liquid. The electrical connections are made and the process takes place; oxygen and hydrogen ions are formed and the liquid conducts a current of electricity.

results.title: Electrodynamics
results.brief_description: The following fundamental principles of current electricity and electro-magnetism are presented in this film: Galvani’s discovery of current electricity; a magnetic field about a current-carrying wire; the magnetic field of a coil; electromagnets; Rowland’s experiment; magnetic hypothesis; recalescence; induction by a magnet; AC and DC generators; induction by an electric current; and transformers and their function.
results.description: The following fundamental principles of current electricity and electro-magnetism are presented in this film: Galvani’s discovery of current electricity; a magnetic field about a current-carrying wire; the magnetic field of a coil; electromagnets; Rowland’s experiment; magnetic hypothesis; recalescence; induction by a magnet; AC and DC generators; induction by an electric current; and transformers and their function.

results.title: Electro-magnetic waves. Part 2. Properties and behaviour of electro-magnetic waves
results.brief_description: Part of the Advanced Science series. Animated diagrams show how the velocity of electro-magnetic radiation is determined, and the properties of refraction, dispersion, diffraction, interference, polarisation, and absorption of electro-magnetic radiation by the earth’s ionosphere and atmosphere. The uses of different frequencies of electro-magnetic radiation including micro waves for communication and the working of gas and solid state laser.

results.title: Electro-magnetic waves. Part 1. The Discovery and generation of electro-magnetic waves
results.brief_description: Part of the Advanced Science series. The discovery of the electro-magnetic spectrum from Newton’s observations on the composition of white light through the discovery of infra-red and ultra violet waves, to the more recent discoveries of radio and gamma waves. Demonstrates methods of generation, and modern uses of electro-magnetic radiation.

results.title: Electro-magnetic induction
results.creator_credit: E Smith Morris and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The generation, by induction, of current in a conductor situated in a magnetic field of changing intensity, is shown by animated diagrams and an electrically operated model railway.

results.title: The Electro-magnet
results.creator_credit: Harry Dance, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: The principles and application of the electro-magnet, production of magnetic fields by simple experiments; effect of introducing iron cores; retention of magnetism by a steel core; use of electro-magnets in telephone receivers and telephone exchanges; a “self-starter” of a motor vehicle leads on to consideration of AC and DC motors.

results.title: Electricity: generation and distribution
results.brief_description: Episode 6 of the series “Is this job for me” on the electricity supply industry. The jobs in the industry are shown by tracing the apprenticeships of two boys who went to the same school; one who enters the generating side and the other the distribution side of industry.

results.title: Electricity from chemicals
results.brief_description: Explains chemical reactions which produce electric current in a simplified electric cell. Discusses dry cell, nickel-cadmium and lead storage batteries. Introduces such terms as ion, charge and electrode. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Explains chemical reactions which produce electric current in a simplified electric cell. Discusses dry cell, nickel-cadmium and lead storage batteries. Introduces such terms as ion, charge and electrode. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Electricity and movement
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description: The basic principles of the electric motor. Opens with an account of the properties of magnets. Compares the action of permanent magnets and electro-magnets. An electro-magnet is used to work an electric bell. An electro-magnet is then adapted so that it turns on an axle and, in this way, the development of a simple electric motor is demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.description: The basic principles of the electric motor. Opens with an account of the properties of magnets. Compares the action of permanent magnets and electro-magnets.
